Do the couple of sentences above sound familiar? If so, you have just witnessed a internet user with an inflated sense of entitlement. Also known as fucktards, dumbasses and douchebags, the ISE thinks that if it can navigate it's way to a download page, it deserves said download at the speed of light.

Here is a personal message to any ISE who reads this:

You are not paying for this game. Every time you whine and bitch about how it isn't going fast enough, you make a part of my soul die. YOU DID NOT PAY FOR THIS GAME. It doesn't matter if it takes a day, a month or a year. If you want it instantly go shell out the cash.

I understand that your life is an empty and meaningless husk. Video games let you fill that gaping void of nothing for a few hours to stave of the thoughts of doing something useful with your life. The act of crying about the fact that you are not playing this game as soon as you want will only interest your mother and incite the rage of everyone else.

And honestly, she probably wants you to get out of her basement and find a job.

"I understand that your life is an empty and meaningless husk."

That one sentence actually pertains to about 95% of all human beings. U see it everyday and everywhere!

*In a little child's voice*

It'll probably be done between a week and a month. With AC2 it took a while for all the values to be logged, but since this game is a lot shorter and not nearly as open ended (i.e. no sandbox) it won't take as long. Also, hopefully the emulator will be easier to get up and running, with experience making the last one. My guess is 2 weeks for the dormine emulator to work. Maybe less for a scene release if they hunker down on it
